newsitem.title: CANADA: RUGBY UNION-ARGENTINA IN THRILLER OVER U.S., CANADA ALSO PREVAIL.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-ARGENTINA IN THRILLER OVER U.S., CANADA ALSO PREVAIL.

text.p: Argentina beat the
United States 29-26 in an action-packed thriller, while Canada
downed Uruguay 24-18 in a sluggish match in the opening games
of the four-nation Pan American rugby tournament.
The first game of the double-header ended in heartbreak
for the Americans as Gonzalo Quesada scored a penalty with
less than a minute to go to put his team into a 29-26 lead.
Then, with the final whistle about to go, the Americans
were awarded a penalty -- all they needed to tie the game.
But Matt Alexander, who had already scored four penalties
and two conversions, missed when his skill was most critically
needed.
The second game saw an inexperienced Canada, playing with
seven first-time internationals, against an out-of-shape
Uruguay.
Uruguay went into an early lead with a try by Antonio
Dabbo, but two Bob Ross penalties and a try by Kevin
Wirachowski put the Canadians into an 11-5 lead, an advantage
they would never concede.
The Uruguayans failed to score again in the first half. A
drop goal by Canadian substitute Jason Penaluna and a
conversion by Ross gave the Canadians a halftime lead of 18-5.
Although Uruguay was more aggressive in the second half,
it was too little too late and Canada easily held on to win.
The next double-header is scheduled for Wednesday at
Hamilton, Ontario. The tournament ends with a final
double-header next Saturday in Markham, Ontario.
Canada and Argentina lead after the first day with four
points each for a win, while both Uruguay and Argentina picked
up one consolation point for losing by seven points or less.
